content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
---------------
No new structures have been successfully placed on the map during these steps. The agent made several attempts to craft and place a Lab at position (0.5, 2.5) in order to supply Automation Science Packs for research; however, each attempt failed due to inventory shortages and missing sub-ingredients. Although pre‐existing furnaces were utilized for smelting (an iron furnace at Position(x=5.0, y=5.0) and a copper furnace at Position(x=-27.0, y=-60.0)), these units were not constructed by the agent and are only part of the resource-processing operations.

ERROR TIPS
---------------
• API Parameter Usage – When calling get_entities, ensure that only supported parameters are provided. Avoid using unsupported keyword arguments (such as “radius”) or supplying extra positional arguments so that the function call exactly matches the defined signature.
  
• Entity Retrieval and Iteration – Check that functions like get_entities return valid collections before iterating over them. Guard against None values to prevent errors such as “‘NoneType’ object is not iterable.”

• Lab Placement – Before attempting to place a Lab at a fixed position (0.5, 2.5), verify that the Lab exists in the inventory. Confirm inventory status and prerequisites to avoid placement errors due to missing items.

• Crafting Prerequisites – Ensure that all sub-ingredients for Lab crafting (for example, iron-gear-wheels, electronic-circuits, and copper-cables) are available in the required quantities. Establish and verify complete production chains (including sufficient smelting of iron and copper plates) before reattempting Lab crafting to prevent shortages and cascading crafting failures.
